title: 103_hr5098
content: The Act titled "Fort Peck Tribes- Montana Compact Act of 1994" is ratified and confirmed, approving agreements related to the use of water rights. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for the delivery, use, or transfer of water rights, subject to Secretary approval. The agreements can last up to 50 years and include diversions or use of tribal water rights within or outside the Reservation. The Secretary must approve or disapprove agreements within 180 days of submission. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes can enter Water Agreements for water rights, lasting up to 50 years, with Secretary approval. Enforcement can be done under section 1361 of title 28, United States Code. The Department of the Interior must treat related information confidentially. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes can enter Water Agreements for water rights with Secretary approval, lasting up to 50 years. The Tribes may not authorize the use of tribal water rights outside the Basin. An "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established in the Treasury for economic development. The Secretary of the Treasury shall deposit interest accruing on funds in a separate account for use by the Secretary of the Interior for tribal economic development and land acquisition within the Reservation. The Act allows for the acquisition of lands within the Reservation from willing sellers and their improvement, with funds deposited in the nonreimbursable and nonreturnable account. Payments made under this Act will not affect federal services or programs for the Tribes, are not subject to income tax, and will not impact power rates. No funds will be distributed on a per capita basis to any member of the Tribes. The Tribes will waive claims against the United States in exchange for the congressional authorization and funding for the Fund. This includes settling water rights under the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact. Funds will not be distributed per capita to any tribal member. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact ratified in 1985 defines reserved water rights for the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Reservation. The Reservation is the Fort Peck Indian Reservation confirmed by an agreement in 1886 and an Act in 1888. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and Tribes refer to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. Tribal water right is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The term "Fund" refers to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund established by section 3(f)(1) in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact.
